title: How to Determine a Proper Height to Hang a Dining Chandelier

steps.title: Measure the depth of table.
steps.content: Measure the depth of table. Most dining tables are 28 to 30" high (29 inches being most common).

steps.title: Measure the distance between the table and the light fixture.
steps.content: Measure the distance between the table and the light fixture. The bottom of your light fixture should be 30 to 34 inches (76.2 to 86.4 cm) above the table.

steps.title: Hang it even higher, so no one can possibly bump into it, if it is a translucent and solid chandelier.
steps.content: Hang it even higher, so no one can possibly bump into it, if it is a translucent and solid chandelier.

steps.title: Measure the distance between the chain of the chandelier and the ceiling.
steps.content: Measure the distance between the chain of the chandelier and the ceiling. In a room with an 8 foot (2.4 m) ceiling, the cord/chain would be 3 feet (0.9 m) long, leaving your chandelier about 60 inches (152.4 cm) off the floor.
